pages.title: ⍟ Queen of Pentacles ⍟
pages.text: Queen of the Thrones of Earth$(br)      ∇ Water of $(m)∇$() Earth

A crowned woman sits upon a throne in a lush garden, surrounded by a verdant scenery.$(br)  She cradles a pentacle with both hands and looks down on it with loving care, contemplating worlds therein.$(br)  Luscious plants and flowers surround her, representing her connection to elemental Earth, nature, and abundance.$(br)  She is wise. Material success and sensual pleasure come naturally to her; and like Mother Nature, she remains

quiet and content about her accomplishments.$(br)  She is involved, in an abstract way, with the real world in all its complexity and belongs to life at its deepest level.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Opulence, generosity, security, liberty.$(br)  May signify someone deeply connected to nature; or someone intense and silent, involved with their own concerns.
$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Suspense, fear, mistrust.$(br)  A need for sociability, expression, activities involving others.
